### Problem

<p>Bear recently studied the depth first traversal of a Tree in his Data Structure class. He learnt the following algorithm for doing a dfs on a tree.<br></p>
<pre><code>void dfs(int v,int p){
    vis[v] = 1;
    for(int i=0;i&lt;G[v].size();++i){
        if(G[v][i]!=p)
            dfs(G[v][i],v);
    }
}
</code></pre>
<p>Now he was given an array <em>A</em>, Tree <em>G</em> as an adjacency list and <em>Q</em> queries to answer on the following modified algorithm as an homework.</p>
<pre><code>void dfs(int v,int p){
    vis[v] += 1;
    for(int j=1;j&lt;=A[v];++j){
        for(int i=0;i&lt;G[v].size();++i){
            if(G[v][i]!=p)
                dfs(G[v][i],v);
        }
    }
}
</code></pre>
<p>The <em>Q</em> queries can be of the following two types :</p>

<p><strong>INPUT</strong><br>
The first line contains two integers <em>N</em> and <em>Q</em>, the number of vertices in the tree and the number of queries respectively.<br>

The next lines contains <em>N</em> integers denoting the elements of array <em>A</em>.<br>
